sentiment_classifier.task package

Submodules

sentiment_classifier.task.checkpoint module

sentiment_classifier.task.extract module

sentiment_classifier.task.extract_helper module

sentiment_classifier.task.extract_helper.extract_chroma(X, sr, win_length, n_chroma)

Extract chroma from given audio signal and return average across time for each chroma.

sentiment_classifier.task.extract_helper.extract_features(audio, sr, audio_limit=110250, mel_window_length=8, n_mels=128, mfcc_window_length=512, n_mfcc=20, chroma_window_length=32, n_chroma=12) → numpy.ndarray

Extracts librosa features from a single audio signal.

Parameters

  • audio (List[float]) – raw audio signal

  • sr – audio sample rate

  • audio_limit – audio longer than this limit will be trimmed to this value

  • mel_window_length – length of window used to compute melspectrogram

  • n_mels – num mel frequencies computed

  • mfcc_window_length – length of window used to compute MFCCs

  • n_mfcc – num MFCCs computed

  • chroma_window_length – length of window used to compute chroma

  • n_chroma – num chroma computed

Type

sr: int

sentiment_classifier.task.extract_helper.extract_melspectrogram(X, sr, win_length, n_mels)

Extract melspectrogram from given audio signal and return average across time for each mel-frequency domain.

sentiment_classifier.task.extract_helper.extract_mfcc(X, sr, win_length, n_mfcc)

Extract mfcc coefficients from given audio signal and return average across time for each coefficient.
